pr_title: Add (a lot) more UI test utilities and Test Infrastructure Improvements. See description for complete context!

timeline.message: Add utils for CP device registration and enrollment
Add more utilities for UI Tests
Add ui test utils for 1p apps as well as Settings screen
Add auth ui utilities for 1p apps
Add device enrollment failure recovery rule
Fix remove account from Settings page
Add change date util for samsung devices
Add javadoc and comments to code
Add nonnull and final where needed
Configure broker install source via CLI

+/**
+ * An interface describing a first party application and the actions that can be performed on them.
+ */
+public interface IFirstPartyApp {
+
+    /**
+     * Add the first user account to this first party app
+     *
+     * @param username                the username of the account to add
+     * @param password                the password of the account to add
+     * @param promptHandlerParameters the prompt handler parameters indicating how to handle prompt
+     */
+    void addFirstAccount(@NonNull final String username,
+                         @NonNull final String password,
+                         @NonNull final FirstPartyAppPromptHandlerParameters promptHandlerParameters);
+
+    /**
+     * Add another account to this first party app. This must only be called if the an account was
+     * previously added to this first party app.
+     *
+     * @param username                the username of the account to add
+     * @param password                the password of the account to add
+     * @param promptHandlerParameters the prompt handler parameters indicating how to handle prompt
+     */
+    void addAnotherAccount(final String username,
+                           final String password,
+                           final FirstPartyAppPromptHandlerParameters promptHandlerParameters);
+
+    /**
+     * This method can be called handle welcome screens in the first party app that appear on the
+     * successful addition of an account to that first party app

replies.bodyText:
From: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/solaris/javadoc.html#comments
First sentence - The first sentence of each doc comment should be a summary sentence, containing a concise but complete description of the declared entity. This sentence ends at the first period that is followed by a blank, tab, or line terminator, or at the first block tag. The Javadoc tool copies this first sentence to the member summary at the top of the HTML page.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: I like your suggestion....we can track of how many accounts are added internally in our app model classes and just create one method here addAccount and change the behavior of it depending on if there was already an account added or not. I think this make sense and I'll incorporate that change.
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText:
This actually isn't that simple because some apps like Microsoft Word, simply launching them adds an account to the app (without user interaction). So a caller could simply call word.launch() and that would add the first account to the app.
I think we can also make improvements here overall in terms of when someone calls addAccount then is it their repsonsilbility to make sure that they have called launch prior to that. The code currently assumes that the app is launched and open when someone calls addAccount and will fail the test case if the app isn't open because it wouldn't find the appropriate UI element. Looking more into UI Automator, I think I can use the getCurrentPackageName internally in addAccount to decide if we also need to launch the app or not. I'm thinking I'll leave the code as is for now, and create a backlog item for these changes and address both of these (distinct methods for adding accounts, and us vs them launching the app) next month.
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Ew.  Sounds like there's a plan, then.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: nit: This is technically first run, right?
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText:
I'd say no....I consider first run to be UI that only appears on the very first launch of an app or subsequent launches until the user dismisses it. For example Authenticator app has welcome screens that appear until you go past them.
This UI in Outlook, however, appears as long as there isn't an account in Outlook and not necessarily first run or one time experience.
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText:
Not related to this PR:
This makes me wonder if there's a clear signal if the test breaks because Word, etc decide to change its UI?
Use case: Word shipped a new UI in the middle of our hot fix release. With a clear sign (ideally without having to go through the error logs), we would know that we could run the test with Word manually, and update this class later.
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText:
There would be precise error logs indicating that an element with this specific id is not found. The test wouldn't know however, if an element wasn't found due to Word changing their UI or if this was simply an issue with UI Automator. IMO, the error message about the element should be enough to guide us to do the following:

Retry Test via Automation
If still fails, it is probably that Word changed their UI, then we should attempt manual
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: We're going to make changes to this UI soon (to support device less PRT). How would one debug this class/function with a local UI change?
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: The ultimate goal is to publish this library/module i.e uiautomationutilities as an artifact in ADO. Then we can start maintain different versions of this library and allow us to locally change from local to dist. It would then make sense for anyone working on broker UI to also make changes to UI Test utilities for broker that listed in this class and a few other classes. This would allow us to debug/run the tests with local UI changes and also makes sure that UI automation utilities are updated accordingly without breaking existing tests.
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: Would it be possible to clear all registered device first prior to running this test?
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: If we have some signal then yes.....with that said, I'll probably refactor the test cases to just use temp users so this never happens. Both have their pros and cons though.....creating temp user is also a bottleneck as it takes a bit of time for AAD to start recognizing that user...so we have to put thread sleep before we try to use it.
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Probably different for each OS version, device model, skin etc....this is currently optimized for Galaxy S6. I'll update the Javadoc with that info.

timeline.bodyText:
Would this be different for each Play Store app version?
FYI, for every comment like this, I'm not asking you to implement/support all possible version, but it would really be great to have a clear signal that tells something like.... "Google Play Store changes their UX in page A. We're trying to do B but now we can't." without having to debug, or dig through logs.
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: I think we would ultimately want those kinds of error messages, I am bit hesitant to put those right now as we still don't know a lot about the reliability of these tests. Once we get these to run on a nightly basis on some pipeline on a few different devices and we get a more comprehensive sense of their reliability, then we can go in and provide those kinds of error messages.
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: Question: If these elements can't be found (due to app update, for example), do these fail in a way that's easy to understand/correct?
timeline.author: iambmelt

replies.bodyText: Or..... should we assert the existence of these buttons? 🤔
replies.author: iambmelt

replies.bodyText:
The test would fail with an AssertionError and there would be precise error logs indicating that an element with this specific id is not found. The test wouldn't know however, if an element wasn't found due to the app changing their UI or if this was simply an issue with UI Automator. IMO, the error message about the element should be enough to guide us to do the following:

Retry Test via Automation
If still fails, it is probably that the App changed their UI, then we should attempt manual
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: Suggestion: navigateTo() (browse() wasn't very to me)
timeline.author: iambmelt
